ref: 3315 kumbhā f. ʻ harlot ʼ, kumbhīˊka -- m. ʻ catamite ʼ Suśr. [kumbhá -- 1: cf. Av. xumba -- ʻ catamite ʼ and semant, P. N. H. G. pātar f. ʻ harlot ʼ prob. ← Sk. pātra -- . Ac. to P. Thieme ZDMG 91, 121 kumbhā -- is hypochoristic for kumbhadāsī -- f. ʻ harlot ʼ: see also kuṇḍa -- 2]
Kho. kumā ʻ harlot ʼ, (Lor.) ʻ concubine of the Mehtar ʼ.
